title: Instructional Design for Medication Education for Hearing-Impaired Patients: Self-Directed Learning Based on Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Pharmaceutical Knowledge and General Understanding of Educational Theory
context.additional_context: A blended learning course combining microlearning materials and offline workshops for prospective/teachers to develop medication education competencies for hearing-impaired patients. Practical skills are assessed through personalized learning progress tracking and project-based evaluations.

learning_goals: Explain at least three medication education strategies considering communication characteristics and health literacy of hearing-impaired patients.
Design and execute at least one role-play scenario with hearing-impaired patients using microlearning content.
Self-directively complete (over 80%) and pass quizzes (over 70 points) on medication education content via the Moodle platform.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
